Inside Macintosh: Macintosh Toolbox Essentials /
Chapter 2 - Event Manager / Event Manager Reference

Data Structures

This section describes the event record, target ID record, high-level event message record, and structure of the Operating System event queue. The Event Manager
uses event records to return information about events. You can use a target ID record
to specify or identify the address of another application or process with which your application is communicating. If your application supplies a filter function as a parameter to the GetSpecificHighLevelEvent function, your filter function
receives information about high-level events in a high-level event message record.

Subtopics
The Event Record
The Target ID Record
The High-Level Event Message Record
The Event Queue
